description: The libretto of the Grammy-, Tony- and Pulitzer Prize-winning musical, annotated by its creator, along with backstage photos,interviews and a production history.
title: HAMILTON: THE REVOLUTION
author: Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jeremy McCarter

description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the comedian, now the host of “The Daily Show,” whose parents were in an illegal (under apartheid) interracial relationship.
title: BORN A CRIME
author: Trevor Noah

description: An oral history of the show, based on extensive interviews with Jon Stewart and others.
title: THE DAILY SHOW (THE BOOK)
author: Chris Smith

description: Filmmaking secrets, photography and artwork from “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them,” written by J. K. Rowling.
title: THE CASE OF BEASTS
author: Mark Salisbury

description: Photographs and interviews from the creator of the blog and the book “Humans of New York.”
title: HUMANS OF NEW YORK: STORIES
author: Brandon Stanton

description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.
title: SAPIENS
author: Yuval Noah Harari

description: Four hundred color photos of New Yorkers, with brief commentary by the author.
title: HUMANS OF NEW YORK
author: Brandon Stanton

description: An account of the birth of one of the 20th century's major intellectual movements and the revolutionary thinkers who shaped it: Jean-Paul Sartre, Simone de Beauvoir, Albert Camus, and others.
title: AT THE EXISTENTIALIST CAFE
author: Sarah Bakewell

description: A concise history of ancient Rome.
title: SPQR
author: Mary Beard

description: The creator of The New York Times dialect quiz provides a guide to how words are pronounced in different parts of the country.
title: SPEAKING AMERICAN
author: Josh Katz
